title: Zed W-Q-W bug [GAMEPLAY]

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Kihno,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=svKZjZZ0,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-12-01T04:40:45.050+0000)
>
> {{champion:238}} 
> Whenever I shadow(W) then shuriken(Q) then W immediately again it doubles the q at where I first was (Before I w'd to shadow)
> 
> It seems you can do it anytime if you immediately go to your shadow after your q

WHY WOULD YOU REVEAL IT

*WHY*

Because it's extremely annoying and detrimental to the Zed player. It also heavily limits your range and prevents you from jumping to your shadow for a quarter of a second unless you want to lose a shitload of range by making it fire the Q starting from where you were rather than where you put the shadow.

First of all, thanks for the report. 

I'm very sorry about this bug, it was an oversight on my part, and a fix is being tested right now!

X.x RIP

Inb4 working as intended.

Couple extra bugs with Zed for you; they're aesthetic though.

All of Zed's skins (including classic, excluding Project) are missing the "shadow creation" sound from W. It is instead replaced with "Shadow swap" sound. 

Zed's Project skin has the shadow creation sound swapped with the shadow swap sound. 

Zed's Project skin does not wind-down normally after emotes. His model just kind of "slips" back into the idle stance rather than using the wind-down animation.
This I dont know how to fix, but will forward to the right people
